data.data:
Initial comments:This report is the result of an unannounced onsite complaint investigation completed on February 2, 2024, at Excela Health Westmoreland Hospital. At the time of the investigation, the facility was not in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998. Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an unannounced onsite complaint investigation completed on February 2, 2024, at Excela Health Westmoreland Hospital. At the time of the investigation, the facility was not in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998. Plan of Correction: 123.5 LICENSURE ADMINISTRATION OF ANESTHESIA:123.5  Administration of anesthesia Anesthesia care shall be provided 
by a qualified physician, 
anesthesiologist, resident physician 
in training, dentist anesthetist, 
qualified nurse anesthetist under the 
supervision of the operating physician 
or anesthesiologist, or supervised 
nurse trainees enrolled in a course 
approved by the American Board of 
Nurse Anesthetists.Observations:Based on review of facility documentation, record review (MR), and staff interview (EMP), it was determined the facility failed to ensure that anesthesia was administered by a qualified practitioner for one of one medical records reviewed (MR1).Findings include:A review, on February 2, 2024, at 9:30 A.M., of the facility's Protocol for Patient Management, review date April 2023, revealed... "Ketamine Infusion for Pain Management...ED, ICU, SDU...Protocol for Patient Management...OBJECTIVE,  To outline the nursing management of a patient receiving a ketamine infusion. ...It has been used clinically in sub-anesthetic doses for the treatment of neuropathic and acute and chronic pain syndromes". During an interview on February 2, 2024, at 9:45 A.M., EMP1 confirmed that nurses in the Emergency Department administer Ketamine to patients for pain management.On February 2, 2024, a request was made for a Keatmine Intramuscular (IM) policy. None was provided.A review of MR1 on February 2, 2024,  revealed that the patient received 300 mg of Ketamine IM by Registered Nurse PF1, on January 27, 2024, at 8:12 AM and at 9:15 AM.During an interview on February 2, 2024 at approximately 11:00 AM, EMP1 confirmed the above findings. Plan of Correction - To be completed: 02/15/2024On 2/2/2024, The Chief Nursing Officer, Medical Director of the Emergency Department, Nursing Clinical Director of the Emergency Department, and Regulatory Analyst reviewed the Patient Management, Ketamine Infusion for Pain Management Nursing Protocol.  The team determined that there was no need to revise the protocol.  Additionally, the team determined that the organization does not have a Ketamine Intramuscular policy.  Upon review of the protocol and survey findings, the team concurred, effective February 2, 2024, Ketamine IM will not be administered by a RN in the Emergency Department. This practice change was communicated to all Emergency Department providers and nursing staff via email by the Emergency Department Medical Director on 2/2/2024. The notification also noted that if the physician desires to use Ketamine IM, the physician must give the IM injection and nursing will document such in the electronic medical record as will the physician that administers the drug. To ensure compliance, the Regulatory Analyst will audit the administration of Ketamine IM in the ED daily for the months of February, March, and April utilizing a report developed by the Nursing Informatics Department.  The Regulatory Analyst will review who administered the drug and the documentation of such in the electronic medical record for any administered doses. Compliance will be monitored for 3 months (2/5/24 through 4/30/24) with the expectation of 100% for 3 consecutive months. If performance falls below 100% during this timeframe, ongoing monitoring will continue until such time as it is maintained at 100% for 3 consecutive months. Any episodes of non-compliance will be addressed immediately, and the staff member will be re-educated on the performance expectations. 123.5 LICENSURE ADMINISTRATION OF ANESTHESIA: 123.5  Administration of anesthesia Anesthesia care shall be provided 
by a qualified physician, 
anesthesiologist, resident physician 
in training, dentist anesthetist, 
qualified nurse anesthetist under the 
supervision of the operating physician 
or anesthesiologist, or supervised 
nurse trainees enrolled in a course 
approved by the American Board of 
Nurse Anesthetists. Observations:Based on review of facility documentation, record review (MR), and staff interview (EMP), it was determined the facility failed to ensure that anesthesia was administered by a qualified practitioner for one of one medical records reviewed (MR1).Findings include:A review, on February 2, 2024, at 9:30 A.M., of the facility's Protocol for Patient Management, review date April 2023, revealed... "Ketamine Infusion for Pain Management...ED, ICU, SDU...Protocol for Patient Management...OBJECTIVE,  To outline the nursing management of a patient receiving a ketamine infusion. ...It has been used clinically in sub-anesthetic doses for the treatment of neuropathic and acute and chronic pain syndromes". During an interview on February 2, 2024, at 9:45 A.M., EMP1 confirmed that nurses in the Emergency Department administer Ketamine to patients for pain management.On February 2, 2024, a request was made for a Keatmine Intramuscular (IM) policy. None was provided.A review of MR1 on February 2, 2024,  revealed that the patient received 300 mg of Ketamine IM by Registered Nurse PF1, on January 27, 2024, at 8:12 AM and at 9:15 AM.During an interview on February 2, 2024 at approximately 11:00 AM, EMP1 confirmed the above findings. Plan of Correction - To be completed: 02/15/2024On 2/2/2024, The Chief Nursing Officer, Medical Director of the Emergency Department, Nursing Clinical Director of the Emergency Department, and Regulatory Analyst reviewed the Patient Management, Ketamine Infusion for Pain Management Nursing Protocol.  The team determined that there was no need to revise the protocol.  Additionally, the team determined that the organization does not have a Ketamine Intramuscular policy.  Upon review of the protocol and survey findings, the team concurred, effective February 2, 2024, Ketamine IM will not be administered by a RN in the Emergency Department. This practice change was communicated to all Emergency Department providers and nursing staff via email by the Emergency Department Medical Director on 2/2/2024. The notification also noted that if the physician desires to use Ketamine IM, the physician must give the IM injection and nursing will document such in the electronic medical record as will the physician that administers the drug. To ensure compliance, the Regulatory Analyst will audit the administration of Ketamine IM in the ED daily for the months of February, March, and April utilizing a report developed by the Nursing Informatics Department.  The Regulatory Analyst will review who administered the drug and the documentation of such in the electronic medical record for any administered doses. Compliance will be monitored for 3 months (2/5/24 through 4/30/24) with the expectation of 100% for 3 consecutive months. If performance falls below 100% during this timeframe, ongoing monitoring will continue until such time as it is maintained at 100% for 3 consecutive months. Any episodes of non-compliance will be addressed immediately, and the staff member will be re-educated on the performance expectations.

Initial comments:This report is the result of a Department of Human Services, Chapter 5100 Mental Health Procedures Act Survey conducted on January 16, 2024, at Excela Health Westmoreland Hospital.  It was determined the facility was in compliance with requirements of the Chapter 5100 Mental Health regulations. Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of a Department of Human Services, Chapter 5100 Mental Health Procedures Act Survey conducted on January 16, 2024, at Excela Health Westmoreland Hospital.  It was determined the facility was in compliance with requirements of the Chapter 5100 Mental Health regulations. Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is the result of an unannounced onsite investigation completed on October 24, 2023, at Excela Health Westmoreland. It was determined that the facility was in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998. Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an unannounced onsite investigation completed on October 24, 2023, at Excela Health Westmoreland. It was determined that the facility was in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998. Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is the result of an onsite occupancy survey conducted on September 29, 2023, with continued document review, at the Excela Square Connellsville, Outpatient Services (Specimen Collection facility), located at 854 Vanderbilt Road, Connellsville, PA 15425. Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Hospital and Health Care Facilities.  Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an onsite occupancy survey conducted on September 29, 2023, with continued document review, at the Excela Square Connellsville, Outpatient Services (Specimen Collection facility), located at 854 Vanderbilt Road, Connellsville, PA 15425. Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Hospital and Health Care Facilities.  Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is the result of an occupancy survey conducted on September 27, 2023 at Excela Health-Westmoreland Hospital, which included an onsite visit, at the Weatherwood, Suite 3. Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Outpatient Facilities.   Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an occupancy survey conducted on September 27, 2023 at Excela Health-Westmoreland Hospital, which included an onsite visit, at the Weatherwood, Suite 3. Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Ambulatory Care Facilities, Annex A, Title 28, Part IV, Subparts A and F, Chapters 551-573, November 1999 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Outpatient Facilities.   Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is for new equipment, (2) GEM Premier 5000 Blood Gas Analyzers on June 30, 2023. Excela Health Westmoreland Hospital attested they were in full compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998. Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is for new equipment, (2) GEM Premier 5000 Blood Gas Analyzers on June 30, 2023. Excela Health Westmoreland Hospital attested they were in full compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998. Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is the result of a revisit conducted on June 1, 2023, at Excela Health Westmoreland Hospital as the result of a previous complaint survey re-visit that was conducted on February 23, 2023. It was determined that the facility was in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998.   Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of a revisit conducted on June 1, 2023, at Excela Health Westmoreland Hospital as the result of a previous complaint survey re-visit that was conducted on February 23, 2023. It was determined that the facility was in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998.   Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is the result of a special monitoring survey conducted on June 1, 2023. The facility attestations for the Robotic Cardiovascular Procedures and Philips Azurion 7 M20.It was determined the facility was in compliance with the applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998.   Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of a special monitoring survey conducted on June 1, 2023. The facility attestations for the Robotic Cardiovascular Procedures and Philips Azurion 7 M20.It was determined the facility was in compliance with the applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998.   Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is the result of an occupancy survey conducted on April 17, 2023, with continued document review until April 19, 2023, at Excela Health Westmoreland Hospital, which included Phase 1 of alterations to existing cardiac catheterization labs. Cath Lab #5, was renamed Cath Lab #4. Cath Lab #4 was updated to a Class 3 Imaging Room. Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Hospital and Health Care Facilities. Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an occupancy survey conducted on April 17, 2023, with continued document review until April 19, 2023, at Excela Health Westmoreland Hospital, which included Phase 1 of alterations to existing cardiac catheterization labs. Cath Lab #5, was renamed Cath Lab #4. Cath Lab #4 was updated to a Class 3 Imaging Room. Based on the occupancy survey, it was determined the facility was in compliance with all applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998 and the current edition of the Guidelines for Design and Construction of Hospital and Health Care Facilities. Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is for the new service, Robotic Coronary Artery Bypass Grafts (CABG) and mitral valve surgical procedures, beginning on 03/07/2023. Excela Health Westmoreland Hospital attested they were in full compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998. Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is for the new service, Robotic Coronary Artery Bypass Grafts (CABG) and mitral valve surgical procedures, beginning on 03/07/2023. Excela Health Westmoreland Hospital attested they were in full compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998. Plan of Correction:

Initial comments:This report is the result of a revisit conducted on January 11, 2023, at Excela Health Westmoreland Hospital as the result of a previous complaint survey that was conducted on August 15, 2022.  It was determined that the facility was in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998.   Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of a revisit conducted on January 11, 2023, at Excela Health Westmoreland Hospital as the result of a previous complaint survey that was conducted on August 15, 2022.  It was determined that the facility was in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998.   Plan of Correction:
